isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE (WITH R-12 REFRIGERANT SYSTEM) - SYSTEM MAINTENANCE

svcproc.title: PRE-SEASON SERVICING
svcproc.para: Field experience has indicated that many of the problems incurred with air conditioning- heater systems are the result of lack of regular maintenance. Preventive maintenance and cleanliness of all components within the system are extremely important.
A complete step-by-step pre-season checkout of the air conditioning/heater system will substantially increase satisfactory operation during the season.

step1.para: Check the unit mountings for looseness.
Check condition and tension of all drive belts. Refer to SPECIFICATIONS.
Check heater core fins for material that could restrict air flow.
Check operation of blowers. Clean blower fans if necessary.
Check condition of heater hoses and engine cooling system hoses. Replace if necessary.

note.para: Refer to Service Manual Section for the system being serviced for specific procedures and adjustment.

step1.para: Check refrigerant hose retention and condition. Look for cracks, chafing, or other damage. Inspect all tubing and hoses for dirty or loose connections. All connections must be clean and tight.
Install new air filter in air conditioning unit housing.

note.para: Refer to Service Manual Section for the system being serviced for specific procedures and adjustment.

step1.para: Clean all foreign material from con- denser, radiator, evaporator core and blowers. Cleanliness of the air conditioner components cannot be overemphasized. Lack of proper attention in this area is one of the major causes of costly and unsatisfactory unit operation. As often as necessary, squirt water through the condenser towards the radiator and through the radiator towards the condenser to flush debris from the fins.
Operate the air conditioner and check the system for leaks with a leak detector.
Check the sight glass (system operating) to see that there are no bubbles.
Determine that the system is functioning properly. Refer to PHYSICAL CHECKS.
